intro: Diplotaxis erucoides subvar. hispidula, commonly known as the hairy synandria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
